      • appendExtnt

        public long appendExtnt(byte[] buf,
                        int reqsize)
                 throws CorfuException
        Breaks the bytebuffer is gets as parameter into grain-size buffers, and invokes appendExtnt(List); see appendExtnt(List, boolean) for more details
        Specified by:
        appendExtnt in interface ClientAPI
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to append to the log
        reqsize - size of buffer to append
        Returns:
        see appendExtnt(List, boolean)
        Throws:
        @see - appendExtnt(List, boolean)
        CorfuException
        See Also:
        appendExtnt(List ctnt).

      • appendExtnt

        public long appendExtnt(List<ByteBuffer> ctnt)
                 throws CorfuException
        Appends an extent to the log. Extent will be written to consecutive log offsets.
        Specified by:
        appendExtnt in interface ClientAPI
        Parameters:
        ctnt - list of ByteBuffers to be written
        Returns:
        the first log-offset of the written range
        Throws:
        CorfuException - OutOfSpaceCorfuException indicates an attempt to append failed because storage unit(s) are full; user may try trim() OverwriteException indicates that an attempt to append failed because of an internal race; user may retry BadParamCorfuException or a general CorfuException indicate an internal problem, such as a server crash. Might not be recoverable

                       List<ByteBuffer> ctnt)
                throws CorfuException
        Throws:
        CorfuException

      • readExtnt

        public ExtntWrap readExtnt(long offset)
                    throws CorfuException
        a variant of readExtnt that takes the first log-offset position to read the extent from.
        Specified by:
        readExtnt in interface ClientAPI
        Parameters:
        offset - starting position to read
        Returns:
        an extent wrapper, containing ExtntInfo and a list of ByteBuffers, one for each individual log-entry page
        Throws:
        CorfuException

      • readExtnt

        public ExtntWrap readExtnt()
                    throws CorfuException
        Reads the next extent; it remembers the last read extent (starting with zero).
        Specified by:
        readExtnt in interface ClientAPI
        Returns:
        an extent wrapper, containing ExtntInfo and a list of ByteBuffers, one for each individual log-entry page
        Throws:
        CorfuException

      • sync

        public void sync()
          throws CorfuException
        force a delay until we are notified that previously invoked writes to the log have been safely forced to persistent store.
        Specified by:
        sync in interface ClientAPI
        Throws:
        CorfuException - if the call to storage-units failed; in this case, there is no gaurantee regarding data persistence.

      • setMark

        public void setMark(long offset)
        set the read mark to the requested position. after this, invoking readExtnt will perform at the specified position.
        Specified by:
        setMark in interface ClientAPI
        Parameters:

      • dbg

        public ExtntWrap dbg(long offset)
              throws CorfuException
        return the meta-info record associated with the specified offset. used for debugging.
        Specified by:
        dbg in interface DbgAPI
        Parameters:
        offset - the inquired position
        Returns:
        an ExtntInfo object
        Throws:
        CorfuException - TrimmedCorfuException, BadParam, Unwritten, with the obvious meanings

      • grabtokens

        public long grabtokens(int tcnt)
                throws CorfuException
        utility function to grab tcnt tokens from the sequencer. used for debugging.
        Specified by:
        grabtokens in interface DbgAPI
        Parameters:
        tcnt - the number of tokens to grab from sequencer
        Throws:
        CorfuException - is thrown in case of unexpected communication problem with the sequencer

      • write

        public void write(long offset,
                  byte[] buf)
           throws CorfuException
        Description copied from interface: DbgAPI
        write a byte-buffer at the specified offset. used for debugging. bypasses the sequencer, and goes directly to a certain offset to attempt filling the position.
        Specified by:
        write in interface DbgAPI
        Parameters:
        offset - the position to fill
        buf - the buffer to write
        Throws:
        CorfuException
